triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: The paper addresses hallucination problems in LLMs and uses them as the foundation for augmented dialogue generation.

triples.name: Dialogue system
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an internet-augmented approach to generating dialogue in conversational systems.

triples.name: Information retrieval
triples.relevance: The paper proposes learning to generate search queries and retrieve information from the internet to augment dialogue generation.

triples.name: Natural language generation
triples.relevance: The paper builds on NLG techniques to condition response generation on search results.

triples.name: Retrieval-augmented generation
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an approach where dialogue generation is augmented with information retrieved via internet search.

triples.name: FAISS
triples.relevance: The paper compares its internet search approach against FAISS-based retrieval as a baseline method.

triples.name: Question answering
triples.relevance: The paper employs question answering capabilities when generating search queries from dialogue context.

triples.name: Search engine
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the use of internet search engines to provide up-to-the-minute information for dialogue generation.
